descriptions.description: LAME is an educational tool to be used for learning about MP3 encoding. The goal of the LAME project is to improve the psycho acoustics, quality and speed of MP3 encoding.

set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=lame PACKAGE_VERSION=3.99.5
oegimport libiconv oegimport nasm # compile-time only
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.gz
mkdir -p "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}" cp COPYING LICENSE README "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}/"
configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-gnu-ld --disable-rpath --with-libiconv-prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --bindir=${OEG_BASE_BIN_DIR} --libdir=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR} ${CONFIGURE_HOST_PARA} --disable-gtktest --enable-nasm make make install-strip DESTDIR=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv bin/*.dll bin64/ rm -rf bin # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
